title: Test
yAxis: Average ticket price in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average ticket price in U.S. dollars, with a total of 10 data points.
Overall Average ticket price in U.S. dollars has decreased over the Year

Average ticket price in U.S. dollars is roughly constant from 2006/07 to 2008/09, gradually increasing from 2008/09 to 2009/10, gradually decreasing from 2009/10 to 2010/11, and lastly roughly constant from 2010/11 to 2015/16.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2009/10 and 2010/11.
Max Average ticket price in U.S. dollars about 51.78 was recorded at Year 2009/10
Min Average ticket price in U.S. dollars about 34.75 was recorded at Year 2012/13
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average ticket price in U.S. dollars, with a total of 10 data points. The chart has 8 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2006/07 to 2008/09.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2014/15 to 2015/16.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately constant which exists from 2013/14 to 2014/15.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2012/13 to 2013/14.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2011/12 to 2012/13.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately constant which exists from 2010/11 to 2011/12.
Differently, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2009/10 to 2010/11.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2008/09 to 2009/10.
